summaries.title: Week 4 Recap: Pine Coast Delivers Drama
summaries.content:
Week 3 of the Celina Moose Golden Tee League brought the crew to the scenic but punishing Pine Coast, and the leaderboard tightened up fast. The course was firm, the wind was unpredictable, and mistakes added up quick for anyone who got greedy. But even with the tricky conditions, a handful of players rose to the challenge. CJ Staugler led the pack with a smooth 50, showing off consistent control that kept him ahead of the field. He wasn’t alone, though — Eric Sams (53) and Gabe Archer (54) kept the pressure on all night, each posting strong, steady rounds that showed Pine Coast wasn’t scaring everyone.

Meanwhile, some of the league’s usual contenders found themselves battling the course more than their opponents. Chicken’s aggressive line on a few dangerous holes came back to bite him, leaving him with a 70 — the kind of round Pine Coast saves just for the brave (or unlucky).

Despite the challenges, Week 3 was full of tight battles, clutch putts, and plenty of “what-if” moments. With handicaps now fully in play starting this week, the standings are about to get even more interesting. Pine Coast may be in the rearview, but the season is just getting warmed up — buckle in, because Week 4 is coming fast.

WEEK 4 COURSE: Missouri Hills

summaries.title: Week 2 Recap: Staugler Stays Hot, Monroe Finds Momentum
summaries.content:
The second week of the Golden Tee League brought more fireworks as CJ Staugler continued his hot streak, following up last week’s 54 with a sharp 49 that kept him atop the leaderboard. Donny and Eric Sams held strong with matching totals, showing consistency that could pay off once handicaps kick in after week three.

Meanwhile, Brian Monroe shaved a few strokes off his debut score and hinted at a breakout week ahead. With players still adjusting to the greens and getting a feel for competition, the standings are tight — and the tension’s already building for next week’s round.
